title: ryx
text: ryx package intends make calculating visualizing correlations easier.

title: ryx
text: print function prints object displaying correlation, p-values significance p-values selected outcome variables response variable.
code: data(mtcars) print(ryx(mtcars, y = "mpg", x = c("hp", "wt", "disp", "cyl", "am", "gear"))) #> Correlations of mpg with #>   variable      r        p sigif #> 1       wt -0.868 1.29e-10   *** #> 2      cyl -0.852 6.11e-10   *** #> 3     disp -0.848 9.38e-10   *** #> 4       hp -0.776 1.79e-07   *** #> 5       am  0.600 0.000285   *** #> 6     gear  0.480 0.005401    **

title: ryx
text: summary function summarized sentences variables correlating response variable. displays median, range, amount statistically significant correlations, variables involved variables used.
code: summary(ryx(mtcars, y = "mpg", x = c("hp", "wt", "disp", "cyl", "am", "gear"))) #> Correlating  mpg with  hp wt disp cyl am gear The median absolute correlation was 0.8118599 with a range from -0.8676594 to 0.5998324 6 out of 6 where significant at the p < 0.05 level.

title: Correlating Variables in your Data
text: goal ryx make calculating correlations R easier. ryx, user able return correlations numeric variables user’s data specific variable. ryx function also print, summary, plot function help user better visualize understand relationship variables.
